description: Smallest natural number requiring n words in English (as spoken in England).
references: N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Robert G. Wilson v, American English names for the numbers from 0 to 11159 without spaces or hyphens .
example: One, twenty-one, twenty-one thousand, one hundred and one, one hundred and twenty-one, ...
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 05 2008
